title: Michael Matthews (American football)
text:
Michael Lee Matthews (born October 9, 1983) is a former <a href="American%20football">American football</a> <a href="tight%20end">tight end</a> for the <a href="New%20York%20Giants">New York Giants</a>. He was signed as an <a href="undrafted%20free%20agent">undrafted free agent</a> in 2007. He played <a href="college%20football">college football</a> at <a href="Georgia%20Tech%20Yellow%20Jackets%20football">Georgia Tech</a>.
Matthews earned a <a href="Super%20Bowl%20ring">Super Bowl ring</a> with the Giants in <a href="Super%20Bowl%20XLII">Super Bowl XLII</a>. He was also a member of the <a href="New%20England%20Patriots">New England Patriots</a>, <a href="Detroit%20Lions">Detroit Lions</a>, <a href="Buffalo%20Bills">Buffalo Bills</a>, <a href="Indianapolis%20Colts">Indianapolis Colts</a>, and <a href="Virginia%20Destroyers">Virginia Destroyers</a>.
Early years.
Matthews attended <a href="Sycamore%20High%20School%20%28Cincinnati%2C%20Ohio%29">Sycamore High School</a> in <a href="Cincinnati%2C%20Ohio">Cincinnati, Ohio</a> and was a student and a <a href="Letterman%20%28sports%29">letterman</a> in <a href="High%20school%20football">football</a>, <a href="basketball">basketball</a>, <a href="Track%20and%20field">Track</a>, and <a href="baseball">baseball</a>. In football, he was named as a first team All-City selection, a second team All-District selection, and a first team All-Conference selection. Michael Matthews graduated from Sycamore High School in 2002.
College years.
Matthews played <a href="college%20football">collegiately</a> for the <a href="Georgia%20Tech%20Yellow%20Jackets%20football">Georgia Tech football team</a>
Professional career.
New York Giants.
Matthews was signed by the Giants as an undrafted free agent in 2007. Matthews played in every game for the Giants in the 2007 season as a backup tight end behind <a href="Jeremy%20Shockey">Jeremy Shockey</a> and <a href="Kevin%20Boss">Kevin Boss</a>, in which he was an important contributor to the team's rushing attack with his strong blocking. Matthews went on to win <a href="Super%20Bowl%20XLII">Super Bowl XLII</a> with the Giants; he started the game with Boss in a double tight end formation.
Matthews returned to the Giants to serve as the backup tight end behind Kevin Boss in 2008. Matthews is typically used as a blocking tight end, with Boss being the receiving tight end.
New England Patriots.
Matthews was traded to the New England Patriots on September 5, 2009, in exchange for a conditional <a href="2011%20NFL%20Draft">2011 draft</a> pick. He was waived on October 20; the condition for the trade was not met, meaning the Patriots did not surrender a draft choice.
Detroit Lions.
Matthews was signed by the <a href="Detroit%20Lions">Detroit Lions</a> on December 15, 2009. He was waived on April 20, 2010.
Buffalo Bills.
Matthews signed with the <a href="Buffalo%20Bills">Buffalo Bills</a> on April 21, 2010. He was injury waived on August 23.
Virginia Destroyers.
Matthews was signed by the <a href="Virginia%20Destroyers">Virginia Destroyers</a> of the <a href="United%20Football%20League%20%282009%E2%80%93%29">United Football League</a> on May 19, 2011.
Indianapolis Colts.
On August 9, 2011, Matthews signed with the <a href="Indianapolis%20Colts">Indianapolis Colts</a>.
